markdown: • Paper with embossed or multi-colored logos; potential anti-counterfeiting technology. • Cigarette paper that reveals the company's name (printed with starch) when developed with iodine; potential anti-counterfeiting technology. • Multi-colored/novel design filters with same taste characteristics. • Environmentally friendly cigarettes that use non-bleached paper and UV fadable inks for tipping logos. • Eliminate adhesives by incorporating Velcro-type technology into pulp fibers. • Cigarette paper that changes color as it burns. • Cigarette with heat sensitive graphic. Sales promotion; consumer wins a prize if the cigarette he/she is smoking has a heat sensitive graphic that becomes visible on smoking. RIP band in paper prevents loss of cigarette for prize redemption. • More natural looking products using transparent paper or paper impregnated with tobacco. • Alternative feed stock for cigarette paper. • Use tobacco in non-tobacco cigarette materials. • Recon cigarette paper. •Wide cigarette. •Australian low weight type cigarette. •Differently shaped cigarettes; rectangular, triangular etc. •Coaxial cigarette. •Accordion-type cigarette, expand and contract to desired size. •Variety pack; for e.g. pack containing a mix of lights and full flavor cigarettes. •Safety match cigarette. Taste/Aroma This category is used for novel cigarettes that taste different or have different aromas but whose appearance closely resembles that of a normal cigarette. - Cigarettes with volatile flavors impregnated on activated carbon. Carbon on the inside of the cigarette paper. - Flavor incorporated into cigarettes using a combustible flavor thread. - Print a graduated flavor/additive profile on cigarette paper, inner foil wrap. - Flavor strip in cigarette paper. - Coat tipping with flavors, vitamin C, citrus. * Constant delivery cigarette. * Tailor product to consumers puff profile, * 100% Natural cigarette - Additive free cigarette. * Cigarette containing a minimum of additives. - Straight grade cigarette. - "All American" 100% US Domestic cigarette. - Cigarettes with total reclaim inclusion. - Homogenized blend, e.g. extruded - Fermented tobacco. - "Other" filler materials for cigarettes. - Tobacco substitutes. •Reduced smoke cigarette; e.g. put a low sidestream paper on a 1 mg "tar" cigarette •Better sidestream aroma/reduce sidestream irritants. 499150499 Source: https://www.industrydocuments.ucsf.edu/docs/mxcj0037

chunks.markdown: • Paper with embossed or multi-colored logos; potential anti-counterfeiting technology. • Cigarette paper that reveals the company's name (printed with starch) when developed with iodine; potential anti-counterfeiting technology. • Multi-colored/novel design filters with same taste characteristics. • Environmentally friendly cigarettes that use non-bleached paper and UV fadable inks for tipping logos. • Eliminate adhesives by incorporating Velcro-type technology into pulp fibers. • Cigarette paper that changes color as it burns. • Cigarette with heat sensitive graphic. Sales promotion; consumer wins a prize if the cigarette he/she is smoking has a heat sensitive graphic that becomes visible on smoking. RIP band in paper prevents loss of cigarette for prize redemption. • More natural looking products using transparent paper or paper impregnated with tobacco. • Alternative feed stock for cigarette paper. • Use tobacco in non-tobacco cigarette materials. • Recon cigarette paper.

•Wide cigarette. •Australian low weight type cigarette. •Differently shaped cigarettes; rectangular, triangular etc. •Coaxial cigarette. •Accordion-type cigarette, expand and contract to desired size.
•Variety pack; for e.g. pack containing a mix of lights and full flavor cigarettes.
Taste/Aroma This category is used for novel cigarettes that taste different or have different aromas but whose appearance closely resembles that of a normal cigarette.

- Cigarettes with volatile flavors impregnated on activated carbon. Carbon on the inside of the cigarette paper. - Flavor incorporated into cigarettes using a combustible flavor thread. - Print a graduated flavor/additive profile on cigarette paper, inner foil wrap. - Flavor strip in cigarette paper. - Coat tipping with flavors, vitamin C, citrus.
* Constant delivery cigarette. * Tailor product to consumers puff profile,
* 100% Natural cigarette - Additive free cigarette. * Cigarette containing a minimum of additives.

- Straight grade cigarette. - "All American" 100% US Domestic cigarette. - Cigarettes with total reclaim inclusion. - Homogenized blend, e.g. extruded - Fermented tobacco. - "Other" filler materials for cigarettes. - Tobacco substitutes.
•Reduced smoke cigarette; e.g. put a low sidestream paper on a 1 mg "tar" cigarette •Better sidestream aroma/reduce sidestream irritants.
